desc: This course traces the path of invertebrate evolution from single-celled protozoans to the most primitive chordates. Emphasis is placed upon major breakthroughs in design that enable organisms to exploit new ecological habitats. Laboratories are designed to introduce students to the major invertebrate groups via observation of living animals and through dissection. Students attend lectures plus one three-hour laboratory per week. Counts as "comparative organismal biology" core category. Counts toward neuroscience concentration. Prerequisites: BIO 150 or BIO 126.
name: Invertebrate Biology
notes: Students in BIO 248 must also register for 248 lab. This course has class-year limits. FY students may register after web registration with the permission of instructor. This course has field trips. This course includes an ACE component.
